author: Michael Larabel
description: Valve's open-source Linux graphics team continues carrying out great feats from getting NVIDIA DLSS working on the open-source NVK driver to enhancing Linux GPU driver support for hardware long forgotten about by the hardware vendors. The latest improvement from Valve's stellar group of open-source contributors are some fixes that benefit old Radeon Rx 200 series graphics cards that are more than one decade old...
title: Valve Developer Contributes Open-Source Driver Fixes For 12 Year Old Hawaii GPUs

author: Michael Larabel
description: PyTorch 2.9 is out today ahead of the PyTorch Conference happening next week in San Francisco. Notable with PyTorch 2.9 is better AMD ROCm and Intel XPU installation support via expanded wheel variant support...
title: PyTorch 2.9 Released With Easier Install Support For AMD ROCm & Intel XPUs

author: Michael Larabel
description: Mesa 25.2.5 is out today as the newest bi-weekly point release for these open-source OpenGL and Vulkan drivers. Particularly if you are on Intel graphics of Battlemage or Lunar Lake and potentially older, Mesa 25.2.5 contains a very important bug fix for various rendering issues and potential game hangs/crashes...
title: Mesa 25.2.5 Released With Very Important Intel Driver Fix

author: Michael Larabel
description: It's been four years now since the Open 3D Engine was born out of Amazon's Lumberyard project and hosted by the Linux Foundation. Today marks the release of the Open 3D Engine "O3DE" 25.10 release with the newest features and fixes for this cross-platform game/graphics engine...
title: Open 3D Engine O3DE 25.10 Brings Build Improvements, Vulkan & Linux Fixes

author: Michael Larabel
description: In preparation for Panther Lake laptops shipping in early 2026, after Intel appears to have largely wrapped up work on the Linux driver enablement they are now ensuring the necessary firmware bits are out in time...
title: Intel ISH Firmware Upstreamed Ahead Of Intel Panther Lake Laptops

author: Michael Larabel
description: Last week Amazon/AWS announced the new EC2 M8a instances as their latest-generation, general-purpose compute instances now powered by AMD EPYC 9005 "Turin" processors. Amazon announced the M8a as having up to 30% higher performance and up to 19% better price performance over M7a. With my testing of both at 32 vCPUs, the new AMD EPYC Turin instance provided 1.59x the performance over the prior-generation EPYC Genoa instance!
title: AMD EPYC 9005 Brings Incredible Performance To The Cloud With Amazon M8a Benchmarks

author: Michael Larabel
description: Apple today announced the M5 SoC as the newest in the Apple Silicon family and with claims of 4x the peak GPU compute performance for AI of the M4...
title: Apple Announces M5 With Much Faster GPU For AI

author: Michael Larabel
description: AMD's HIP-RT is used by the Blender 3D modeling software for GPU-accelerated ray-tracing on Radeon GPUs. For Blender 5.0 the AMD HIP-RT support is expected to be declared "stable" but will not be enabled by default until Blender 5.1...
title: AMD HIP-RT Is Stable For Blender 5.0 But Will Be Off By Default Until Blender 5.1

author: Michael Larabel
description: While the open-source GCC and LLVM/Clang compilers saw Panther Lake support added in early 2024, only overnight was support upstreamed to GCC and Clang for the similar Wildcat Lake target...
title: Intel Wildcat Lake "-march=wildcatlake" Added To GCC & LLVM Clang Compilers

author: Michael Larabel
description: In development for around the past year was the cross-vendor mesh shading extension for OpenGL. Last week GL_EXT_mesh_shader was merged to the OpenGL Registry for this mesh shader support and first new GL extension in a while...
title: Mesa's Zink OpenGL-On-Vulkan Driver Lands Mesh Shader Support

author: Michael Larabel
description: David Rosca at AMD continues leading the efforts for improving the open-source Radeon video acceleration support under Linux with the Mesa Gallium3D code. This is especially important now that AMD is encouraging customers to no longer use the AMD Multimedia Framework (AMF) on Linux but resort to using VA-API and the Mesa multimedia capabilities instead...
title: Basic HDR Support For AMD Radeon Accelerated Video Processing On Linux

author: Michael Larabel
description: A new release of exfatprogs is now available as the user-space programs on Linux for the exFAT file-system to complement the in-tree kernel driver for the Microsoft exFAT support...
title: Linux Gains Tool For Defragmenting exFAT Filesystems
